instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3330 magsafe blinking
threads.message:
Board 820-3330
Magsafe is blinking. 
25 seg - OFF
6 seg - ON

ADAPTER_SENSE - 3.3V always
PP18V5_DCIN_FUSE - 16.6V Always

Diode mode:
DCIN – 1 and 1
PPVBUS-G3H – 1 and 464 

Any idea why magsafe is blinking? Already tried 2 dc boards. PP18V5_DCIN_FUSE too low?

threads.title: 820-3330 magsafe blinking
threads.message: Blinking on-off or green-orange? Check current sensing and chrgr boot on the ISL.

threads.title: 820-3330 magsafe blinking
threads.message:
Blinking on - off. Green - off.
I have 12.6V stable in PPVBUS

threads.title: 820-3330 magsafe blinking
threads.message: ACOK high when light is off? SMC_RESET high? Disconnect keyboard to rule that out.

threads.title: 820-3330 magsafe blinking
threads.message:
ACOK - 3.25V always
SMC_RESET_L - 3.3V always, but I noted that each 30-35seg is goes to 0V for 0.5seg.

threads.title: 820-3330 magsafe blinking
threads.message: No. Comes from other workshop with gpu replaced.

threads.title: 820-3330 magsafe blinking
threads.message: Oh, fucked up garbage. Isn't there a short on some of the GPU power rails?
